column4: Am I stuck with this version or is there a way to update to version 11? I am aware that the Netbook remix was merged into the normal version as of version 11, but I can't seem to find a way to switch over.
I am running Ubuntu Netbook Remix version 10.04.2 LTS.
I changed the update manager to include normal updates, but it still doesn't show version 11's update.
So there's no way to update without a fresh install?
I will actually have more problems because getting this to work in the first place was a pain, mostly because of this computer's lack of any kind of disk drive.
fresh install only takes less than an hour
For me it took about 4 hours after all the work it takes to get it to work with this blasted laptop. For some reason it just hates trying to boot from anything that isn't a hard drive.
what about ubuntu-desktop thru terminal have you tried that method?
I'm not sure what you mean.
It came back "install: missing destination file operand after `ubuntu-dekstop'
isn't that desktop instead of dekstop
I used copy/paste so the blame isn't on me then.
NP. It seems to be working.\
Ok that did the trick! Thank you.
